meanings.definition: Excessive pride in one's appearance or achievements.
meanings.sent1: Her vanity led her to spend hours in front of the mirror, admiring herself.
meanings.sent2: His vanity was evident in the way he constantly talked about his accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: Despite her vanity, she tripped over her own feet while trying to show off.
meanings.sent4: His vanity was like a shiny mirror, reflecting only his own image back at him.
meanings.sent5: The vanity of the peacock was unmatched, as it strutted proudly with its colorful feathers.

meanings.sent1: She sat at her vanity, carefully applying makeup before the party.
meanings.sent2: The antique vanity in the corner of the room held her collection of perfumes.
meanings.sent3: The vanity in the bedroom was cluttered with jewelry and hair accessories.
meanings.sent4: The vanity's mirror reflected her smiling face as she got ready for the day.
meanings.sent5: The little girl loved playing dress-up at the vanity, pretending to be a princess.

meanings.definition: The quality of being worthless or futile.
meanings.sent1: His pursuit of fame turned out to be nothing but vanity in the end.
meanings.sent2: The project was doomed to fail due to its inherent vanity.
meanings.sent3: The vanity of his efforts became clear when no one showed up to his event.
meanings.sent4: She realized the vanity of her dreams when they never came to fruition.
meanings.sent5: The vanity of his excuses only served to highlight his lack of responsibility.

meanings.definition: A bathroom cabinet that houses a sink and plumbing.
meanings.sent1: The new vanity in the bathroom added a touch of elegance to the space.
meanings.sent2: She stored all her toiletries neatly in the drawers of the vanity.
meanings.sent3: The plumber installed the vanity with precision, ensuring it was level.
meanings.sent4: The vanity in the guest bathroom had a marble countertop and a modern design.
meanings.sent5: The vanity's mirror reflected the light, making the bathroom appear brighter.
